TrustExpression: TD_1 AND TD_2 AND TD_3 AND TD_4
Description: This is a candidate Trust Interoperability Profile that specifies a proposed minimum set of requirements for subscriber authentication by NIEF Identity Provider Organizations (IDPOs).

TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Name: Mitigation of Basic Subscriber Authentication Threats
TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Description: This Trustmark Definition covers requirements on Credential Service Providers (CSPs) for mitigating threats of online guessing, replay, eavesdropping, and session hijacking to authentication processes.

TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Name: Subscriber Authentication Process
TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Description: This Trustmark Definition covers basic requirements for subscriber authentication, done by Credential Service Providers (CSPs).

TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Name: Weak Mitigation of Subscriber Authentication MITM Threats
TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Description: This Trustmark Definition covers requirements on Credential Service Providers (CSPs) for weak resistance of the man-in-the-middle threat to authentication processes.

TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Name: Use of Approved Cryptography for Protection of Subscriber Authentication Session Data
TrustmarkDefinitionReference.Description: This Trustmark Definition covers the use of approved cryptography, by Credential Service Providers (CSPs), for protecting session data during authentication processes.

Name: NIEF Minimum Authentication Process Profile
